Small suggestion for the future: the KAX engines have an impact rating (crashTolerance) of only 2.0 m/s. This means the engine usually is the first to go when being hit by rounds or shells. We could mod the engines so they have a higher rating and thus last longer. Usually radials could withstand more battle damage, where liquid cooled engines like the Daimler-Benz and Rolls-Royce could be taken out with one shot. For the sake of gameplay, we could consider the idea of armor plating around the engine, just by increasing it's impact rating to 10.

Here's the original color taken straight from the .cfg.

 projectileColor = 255, 247, 0, 255

And as for the sound, if you don't still have my pack installed -->[here's](http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mods/233392-ww2-air-weapons-for-bda)<--- the link again.

Also i would recommend setting the heating for the other weapons similar to mine. That way the AI can only use shorter bursts as opposed to just filling the sky with bullets.

And i would recommend replacing this section in the .cfg's

 name = BahaTurret

 weaponType = cannon 

 rotationSpeed = 10

With this

 name = BahaTurret

As it will remove the animated explosions(The particle effect as it is too big (Maybe do this for all but the cannons, but i would recommend doing it to those as well)).

I am not going to change the weapons heating, it's a design and strategy choice, if you set your AI to always be far away you are going to waste all of your bullets, or the enemy bullets ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Yeah I did not bother with that yet as it had no gameplay impact, but I am going to remove explosions from some weapons and try to make others smaller, thanks for the tip.

But cannons stay explody, they have cannon parameters.

The next pack update will have fancier descriptions and color changes, maybe some texture changes, but nothing that affects how they work at all.

By the way, from which weapon is that?

The color values are ripped straight from my version of the Hispanio, and the first cannon related segment is from the Berezin UB, and the second from my Hispanio. And the reason i recommended removing the rendered explosion is for FPS and the fact that size of the rendered explosion is still from 105mm same as the muzzle flash, as i believe both are built into the model in unity (i haven't really gotten that far yet). And the quick overheating was just my idea to try and prevent the AI from shooting while still out of range of the weapon.
